reviewText:
For any Halo fans, or fans of Arena FPS in general, this game is for you. Since near it's launch on Xbox a while back this is one of the few games that's had me HOOKED.

The gameplay is solid and fast-paced, with fast enough killtimes to make firefights quick and engaging, but fair to both sides of the confrontation. Advanced movement options such as wall jumping, dashing, crouch-jumping and more bring a different, refreshing take on game flow, with regular players, ninjas, and trickjumpers alike all being able to feel right at home. Weapons are powerful, loud, and responsive. The controls are easy to pick up and very customizable; each in-game action can be binded individually, and full Xbox 360 controller support is included.

As far as level design goes, full power is given to map makers in the form of the game's unique 'Minergun'. Building and filling in structures is as simple as a few clicks with it, with almost every map included being created by the community. JForce does a great job of listening and taking creative input from said community, having more involvement with it than most game developers of today, giving frequent updates as time goes on.

Game modes range from tried-and-true Deathmatch gametypes to CTF to the game's very unique Infection mode, alongside built in features for competitive play such as weapon disabling and placeable on-map weapon spawns.

But no game is perfect. While it's solid controls, gameplay, and ease of access stand out on their own, at the moment there doesn't seem much else to keep coming back to. At the time of this review, there's no matchmaking, dedicated servers, or single player campaign of any sort. No stat recording either. There also aren't any in-game unlockables, which a game like this could really strive from. So, until JForce surprises us with some big updates, whether or not you'll keep coming back relies solely on how much you enjoy the base game.

Nevertheless, any hardcore arena-style FPS fan dying for some new PC action will fall in love with this game, if not for its likeness to Halo, then for its solid controls, gameplay, and ease of map building.

Current score: 9.8/10.

TLDR: Just get the game. It's only $2.50

The gameplay is solid and fast-paced, with fast enough killtimes to make firefights quick and engaging, but fair to both sides of the confrontation. Advanced movement options such as wall jumping, dashing, crouch-jumping and more bring a different, refreshing take on game flow, with regular players, ninjas, and trickjumpers alike all being able to feel right at home. Weapons are powerful, loud, and responsive. The controls are easy to pick up and very customizable; each in-game action can be binded individually, and full Xbox 360 controller support is included.

As far as level design goes, full power is given to map makers in the form of the game's unique 'Minergun'. Building and filling in structures is as simple as a few clicks with it, with almost every map included being created by the community. JForce does a great job of listening and taking creative input from said community, having more involvement with it than most game developers of today, giving frequent updates as time goes on.

Game modes range from tried-and-true Deathmatch gametypes to CTF to the game's very unique Infection mode, alongside built in features for competitive play such as weapon disabling and placeable on-map weapon spawns.

But no game is perfect. While it's solid controls, gameplay, and ease of access stand out on their own, at the moment there doesn't seem much else to keep coming back to. At the time of this review, there's no matchmaking, dedicated servers, or single player campaign of any sort. No stat recording either. There also aren't any in-game unlockables, which a game like this could really strive from. So, until JForce surprises us with some big updates, whether or not you'll keep coming back relies solely on how much you enjoy the base game.

Nevertheless, any hardcore arena-style FPS fan dying for some new PC action will fall in love with this game, if not for its likeness to Halo, then for its solid controls, gameplay, and ease of map building.

Current score: 9.8/10.

TLDR: Just get the game. It's only $2.50

reviewText:
Originally I posted a negative review, but I played it for a little while, and quite a lotta fun.
It's certainly gotten better now that I've found that you can easily mod the block textures.
Moddability is definitely a plus, and the community's ok if you can get them talking.
The devs saw my original review and told me to try it again, so I did.
It was good fun.

I mucked around making maps for a bit, which is a pretty awesome feature.
Made a claustrophobic sorta tunnelly map, and then went to go and play a match or two.
The matchmaking was quick and there was minimal lag, thanks to recent internet upgrades at my end.
I used to not be able to play properly due to slow internet, but now it's better I can play properly and not get killed all the time, only less of the time.

Some of the maps are a bit strange, but they're all community made, so can forgive these things.

But it was still a bit... lacking. It's a solid shooter, it's got map building, and character customisation, what more could I want?
Well, the servers seemed a little sparse, but you guys don't control who plays and when.
I just dunno.

All in all, it's pretty good, and plays like old arena shooters when you really get into it, so that's a plus.
7/10
Glad I bought it, and it's still better than most AAA shooters being pumped out these days.

reviewText:
Don't write this off as some minecraft spin-off. I'd say it's 5% minecraft, 95% Halo. Like I know a lot of people have probably said, it uses block-based maps, and if the host doesn't disable it, you can place and destroy blocks. But a large majority of the time, that's not the focus of the gameplay in the very least. It can be a pretty competitive FPS. Or it can just be a casual game to play with friends, if you're not the competitive type. There's your standard team death match mode, free for all, and capture the flag, which are the competitive modes. And then there's the more laid-back, casual modes in Zombie Survival and Infection. In Infection, all players start out as humans, with one randomly selected player as a zombie. If the zombie kills you, you respawn as a zombie, and the game is over when all the humans are dead. The winner is the player with the most kills. I don't really like it, because it seems like a boring camp-fest, and there's always that one guy that just digs a hole and hides with a shotgun. But overall, this game is really fun. If you like Halo, you'll like this.

The weapons are pretty standard. The sniper, battle rifle, pistol, shotgun, and machine gun are all straight out of Halo. There's also the energy sword, but it works a little differently in this. It doesn't instantly lunge and one-hit-kill like the Halo sword does, but instead has to be charged for 2-3 seconds. Or you can use two weak sword attacks instead. Then there's the hookshot. Basically, it's a grappling hook straight out of batman. Or the hookshot from Legend of Zelda, if you like. Then you've got your frag grenades, which can't kill a full health/shield player, and your plasma grenades, which only kill if you actually stick a player. Everything is pretty well-balanced overall.

In addition to standard fire modes, all weapons have a secondary function or alternate fire mode. The sniper/pistol/battle rifle have scopes. The shotgun camouflages you as the same kind of blocks surrounding you, and the machine gun empties the remainder of its clip at double the normal fire rate. The sword and hookshot don't have alternate fire modes.

Then, there's the miner gun. It can break single blocks, a 1x3 grid of blocks, or a 3x3 grid of blocks at a time. It also has a Blaster" mode that requires time to charge
date: but releases a slow-moving explosive projectile. It can also be changed to "building" mode and used to place blocks

reviewText:
It's this nice blend of Minecraft and Halo 3. Destructable environment, good-enough selection of weapons, and multiple types of multiplayer. The hookshot works really well, and is undoubtedly the most fun thing in the game.
However the population of the game is fairly low. You can meet up with more people at a certain time on Wednesday for the group event (join the game-related group), but if you don't plan on playing with people on hump-day then, well, the spam is real.

Overall, I really like the game but the low population and sometimes odd net-code keep me from playing it.

reviewText: 10/10\nCould be one of the most visually disgusting games I have ever had the pleasure of playing, not only does the game provide a level of next-gen gameplay but it also immerses the player in a complete vat of horse excramate. Murder Miners has made me a changed man, for once it has allowed me to be fully focused and keen on my style of play; as well as increase my urge to commit a Grade A Felony. Unlike it's FPS counterparts such as Dino D-Day and Clash of Clans, MM serves as a bridge between the old school style of gaming and the daily struggles of inmates. However, the price of this game is completely unreasonable, at $1 per copy this is an understatment. The game should be worth around $60 because it has great potential to becoming an extremely (if not already) the worst FPS game available. All in all if you would like to play a game that not only leaves you with your ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• in your hands, but also leaving you begging for more. I suggest getting Adventure Capitalist.

reviewText: Great fun and cheap, like a mix of Halo/Ace of Spades. It's not your typical ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• Minecraft ripoff though, this game is pretty great fun especially with friends. It doesn't take itself too seriously so you will have a lot of crazy and funny moments, there's lots of dumb stuff to try out like turbo fire mode and the grappling hook, which make loads of good fun messing around with it.\n\nAs an example we put on turbo fire + unlimited ammo, and the recoil from the shotgun was so big when you shot it fast that you would literally start flying, and we would grapple hook onto eachother to fling eachother off the map, all kinds of dumb stuff. The graphics aren't great but the gameplay is amazing, the game is just a great and fairly casual shooter which is awesome to play with friends.

reviewText:
The good:

-much content (100s of maps)
-direct, not-obstructionary aim (for example other games have tons of delays, like when zooming in, switching weapons etc. this game is more responsive)
-vehicles (helicopter and speeder)
-direct responsive movement
-you can make your own maps
-2‚Ç¨ /1‚Ç¨ when on sale
-you can make maps

The bad:

-map maker is horrible: it is not an actual seperate tool or anything, it is just literally a weapon that you can equip: you can build single blocks, or infinite lines (yes infinite, as in, will make line until end of map), so if you misclick a line, you have to remove the blocks one by one, also, no undo function. I made a tiny map that consists of a house, fence , tree and garage, in 4 hours. making walls should be easier, and hills are impossible: you have to click block by block

-network issues: I have top tier internet, and I see other players teleporting around , once even someone saw ME teleporting around (how??); also, players with bad internet have an advantage: they teleport, and at random but frequent occasions cannot be hit /godmode. every server has >200 ping, even the ones in Europe. Not sure how this works, but , either this game uses a crappy p2p system (like cod) , or simply has poorly handled server systems

-community, children, ragers, etc. minor point but still, also I get kicked frequently for being too good (no ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• intended, but this game has direct aim, and you can make REALLY cool trickshots in it, literally 360 jump quickscope headshot) ; also accused of cheating

-small playerbase: combined with previous point, makes you encounter the same unlikable people; getting kicked is extremely common

-forgot to mention: there are no official servers, its all by players: you just click host session" and thats it
date: your admin of a temporary server now. so you are completely dependant on other players\n\n-mouse aim: for unknown reasons
recommended: the game doesn't aim normally: it simulates a controller or something; so mouse acceleration is enabled permanently ; it makes you aim like a drunk
hoursPlayed: you can ONLY disable it in WINDOWS options
voteText: NOT ingame!\n\nAll in all
votesHelpful: but not much more; clearly a port and not much attention spent on the huge issues the game has."

reviewText:
This game was fun, but the developers have given up on it and won't fix the many issues in the game because they want you to spend your money on the sequel. I've given up on the developers at this point.

I've bought two copies of this game and I'm really disappointed in the devs that they'd just abandon this game.

Response to Ato (since Steam won't let me post it in the comments due to it being over 1,000 characters in length.)

There are many issues with the game, such as lack of an FOV slider and lack of being able to change resolution in windowed mode and you promised split screen, which is on Xbox, but not PC. The problem I have is that you're expecting us to buy MMX for the fixes. I understand that MMX will have a lot more content, but it's frustrating that in order to have features that should have been in the game from the beginning you have to buy the sequel.

Also note that continuing to update the game will help draw in more fan and keep current fans. Look at games like Warcraft 3 TFT. They've updated it so that you can play it in modern resolutions despite it being 12 years old. Another example is Terraria. It's four years old and got a massive update with at least 800 new items, new events, and new features to make the UI more easy and quick to use. I'm not saying that you should add more content to MM1, just that the issues should be fixed.

I've also realized that this game is impossible for me to play on on a larger resolution monitor due to simulation sickness. I'm fine on my 1440x900 monitor, but on my 1920x1080 monitor the game makes me feel nauseous unless I play windowed, which makes it so I can't focus on the game. An FOV slider that goes up to 90 or higher FOV would fix this (MM1 has approximately 75 FOV which goes up to 90 FOV due to the aspect ratio; which isn't enough for me on a 1920x1080 monitor due to the size of it. I know you've said that TF2 has the same FOV before, which it doesn't. By default the game has 75 FOV on a 4:3 monitor, and 90 FOV on 16:9 monitor. You can increase it to 90 FOV on a 4:3 monitor and up to 110-120 on a 16:9 monitor.) Here's an example of what I mean https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGNpt63gm5c

Yes, I had played many hours and had fun playing competitively, but now that I can't really play on one of my computers and the developers are expecting me to buy MMX for these to be fixed, I've lost faith in JForce.

reviewText:
This game is bad and you should feel bad

EDIT: Response for the dev

Well now you've made me feel bad...

But yeah, i guess my major gripe about the game would be the optimization, the lack of options for changing graphical settings, such as an FOV slider, resolution, amount of AA, and the way the gameplay is in general.
On the subject of gameplay, I find just the general feel to be unsatisfactory. The movement system is both unwieldy, unexpected, and a little clunky when trying to maneuver around. Another gripe that I have about the gameplay is the speed, the general speed with how the aiming and other aspects of weapon handling is in high octane situations. Many times, it's hard to follow what exactly is going on. I think the major cause with this is because the movement system is that of a more slower based fps, while the shooting feels like it was based off a high speed arena shooter ala Unreal Tournament.

Some small minor improvements would be along the line of physical bodies for people. have it so you can not phase through each other. better weapon selection wheel". possible the option to alter the time to kill for matches/maps. I also think an amazing feature that could be added in the future is more customizable options for how the game plays like Halo custom games.

I also guess that another thing that really made me not enjoy the game was that the store page was talking about a Halo-esque playstyle. When I got into game the only Halo-esque features that I could easily recognize is the clip size for guns
recommended: and the shield. Personally I was expecting some gameplay to have the same flow and speed as Halo
hoursPlayed: but that could just be all on me.\n\nIf you haven‚Äôt already
voteText: I would recommend getting ahold of Halo Online/El Dewrito and play that for a bit. It's a quite different experience than normal Halo 3 on Xbox. Maybe with that you could have an easy reference that you could possibly used to improve on the fps game that you make.\n\nP.S. I am a really critical guy about anything I have some interest in and see some potential in."

reviewText:
It's a good game, but it will be under developement for some time. I'm highly impressed with the game however.
The game IS in a sense a combination of Minecraft and Halo, but with a little more customization.

I HIGHLY recommend this for Minecraft fans for the building and destruction assets that you have at your disposal. I do feel it is somewhat limited on what you can and can't do, but hopefully that will be added onto.

While it is still in developement, it's still a great game nonetheless. I recommend getting it soon whilst it's still in developement and while the price will stay low.

Note: It is HIGHLY recommended for Minecraft players or fans. If you're not interested, please don't subject yourself to playing this.

reviewText: I played this game on the Xbox 360 and I have to say, It was easily worth the 240 Microsoft Points($3). This game is even better on the PC. It is basically a mix of minecrafts terrain destruction and building with Halo's combat system. This game has plenty of game modes to play such as team deathmatch, capture the flag and other classics but also has a zombie survival mode and infection which is a mode where a player becomes the infected and has to find and kill all other players. I highly recommend this game as it is hella fun.

reviewText:
Murder Miners is a fun shooter and it's cheap!
Pros
- Customization for your character
- Player created maps to play on plus many more
- You can build as welll as shoot
- Many mode like Infestation, Murdermatch, Murder The Flag etc.
- In any mode you can add alot of thing example (Your playing Murdermatch trying to kill other people while trying to not get eaten by zombies and build a blockade just in case)

Cons
- The game itself is kinda dead its rare to find a full server with a gamemode you like
-  From my Prospestive, I see no build mode so its hard to build without getting sniped or mauled
- Not alot of guns to choose from, i hope they add more

8/10
I recommend this game get it for a few friends
3 words
YOU WILL DIE
no seriously you willl....
It's hard man ;~;

reviewText:
Murder Miners is the love child of Minecraft And Halo, It is a fast paced simplistic FPS with destructable environments


Lets look at the pros and cons

Pros:
Steam Workshop
Large amount of gamemodes
Well Optomized
Heavy character customization
Well balanced weapons

Lets look at the cons now:
Small community, Picks up later in the day at around 6PM *Pacific time*
Low rez graphics *Only a problem for graphics snobs*
No dedicated servers, Okay so this is the one that takes a toll, Without dedicated servers you dont have a standard playfeild to work off of and play when there are no community servers


All in all a great game for anyone on a budget, If you can get past the lack of dedicated servers which i hope to see in the upcoming sequal, If you have friends to play it with buy a 4 pack and play it with them.

reviewText: So far, it was alright. The one complaint I have is, why does the game say it has to send maps to other players even though it's a default map? It actually seems to cause lag when it pops up. Not only that, but when other players are lagging it seems to affect the rest of the players on the server. Is there any way to control what Region can play on your game? Just a thought. Outside of that, it was pretty fun to play. I don't know what to rate this really. Because it's not really a yes or a no for me, more like a maybe. Reason for this being the lag issues. Some maps are also non destructable. I think every map should, and you should be able to blow off parts of the map. That would be cool!\n\nAnyways, I'll give it a yes for now, but barely.

reviewText: *This review was a tad bigger than I had planned for it to be so if you want to hear my actaul thoughts on the game, just skip the giant wall of text*\n\nI did not enjoy this game. I only found it because there was a link on Facebook where you could get a free key, so I figured I might as well get it and give it a try. Upon first launching the game, I was greeted with a character customisation menu featuring all the usual options (including pelvis customisation) and some very loud music. After creating my character, cringing a bit as the character posed to what sounded like 80's cartoon noises, I turned the music off. I then chose to join a game, and I got a list of gamemodes including Murdermatch"
date: "Murder the flag" and "YOLO Mode". As  ‚Ä¢“â NŒ£K√ò-Œ± said in their review
recommended: putting Murder in the name of some gamemodes is not a good thing I mean
hoursPlayed: Murdermatch works but Murder the flag? Not so much. Anyway I tried to join a Murdermatch game and I got a little message saying "No Sessions Found" so I tried the next one but again
voteText: "No Sessions Found". I repeated this process until I finally found a server populated by 3 people in the "Zombie Survival Mode". I joined and I instantly got killed
helpfulPercent: so I respawned. Killed again. On the 5th respawn I was able to spawn away from the other players in a tiny room with a single way in and out so I sat there with a shotgun waiting for something to come past
votesHelpful: at which point 2 or 3 zombies spawned in the room and killed me. The game then ended and I was booted back to the main menu so I sat for the next 10 minutes trying to find a server in other gamemodes. Eventually I found an Infection server
votesTotal: in which I spawned as a zombie so I started hunting down players
votesFunny: while also getting used to the controls as zombies have a weird grappling tentacle thing which worked for me 3 times out of 10. I came across a helicopter type vehicle which I could use
commentsCount: surprising that zombies can do that now a days
column16: and killed quite a few people. It was actually fairly fun to fire all those rockets at the helpless players
column17: that is of course until the chat came alive with angry 13 year olds and I was shot down by another one of the helicopter things
column18: found myslef unable to do anything and eventually booted from the game. At this point I gave up
column19: closed the game and only opened it up again to show it to friends and see what they thought.\n\nOverall
column20: this is just another game with minecraft style visuals and guns
column21: aimed at a younger audience so that it can sell (at least
column22: thats what I thought playing it). While I don't at all doubt this was the "#1 rated Xbox Live Indie Game"
column24: there was nothing that explained how certain game elements worked
column25: there were almost no servers so I still haven't been able to play some of the gamemodes and lastly it feels more like a F2P game than one that is being sold at ¬£1.59 (79p during sales). Also the only things in the game that seem halo-inspired are the vehicles
column26: some weapons and the health bar."

reviewText: Bought this mainly because my little brothers love Minecraft and Halo. It was cheap and harmless. I thought they'd get a few hours of fun and that's it. What shocked me was how fluid the game is. Yeah graphics aren't much but other 'craft' games on steam are usually shoppy and sluggish alot of times. This plays smooth and perfectly. The gameplay is Halo. That's about all I can say. Fast phenetic gameplay, fun deathmatch and capture the flag. The infection mode is really cool aswell. On sale or not you need this game if you want Halo multiplayer on PC.

reviewText:
1/10

1.Same as Halo for example similar sounds like when your shield breaks.
2.No one plays, servers are empty.

reviewText: This game is a fun voxel game on Steam at a very affordable price. I got this game in a bundle, and I mainly got the bundle just to get this game. I've played other voxel games like Ace of Spades, Guncraft and Blockstorm, so I was really happy to add this game to my library, and play it. My first impression were disappointingly negative, as when I tried to join servers, sometimes I would get kicked from them when I joined. And sometimes the host would choose a really bad map that they'd made and sometimes the respawning doesnt function correctly on such maps (i.e. spawning under the map and dying). Also once or twice there was a hacker using speedhacks (turbo shooting and lightning fast running) but they would get kicked. Apart from some particular people, this game is really enjoyable. When you find a decent server you can be playing for many hours straight. Its a great competitive game to play with your friends, and has really nice voxel graphics :) You get to choose 2 guns from a nice array whenever you respawn. The weapons are really nicely balanced, no gun feels under or over powered. The infection mode is nice, and works a bit like Ace of Spades' zombie mode. Because the game is voxel, you can place or even destroy blocks. This makes great dynamic battles, and allows you to bury yourself underground to hide. There are no AI zombies here, and I think that the zombies being able to kill you in one hit is rather unfair, and doesn't give you much of a chance. But if you are alert and teaming up, you have a much better chance and it is fun to hold off all the zombies. In zombies survival, you go up against 100's of zombies, and the first player to reach the pre-defined score set by the host, wins. This is also fun and competitive, but also unfair sometimes due to occasional spawning next to a few zombies which kill you and dont give you a chance to get away. The zombie AI could be improved slightly, and maybe zombies speed could be nerfed, but their health increased. Sometimes the zombies are frustratingly hard if theres no teamwork, so this is definitely great to play as co-op. This gamemode is still very fun to play alone or with friends, and is especially chaotic when theres millions of zombies and its exhilerating to try and hold them off and run away. The PvP gamemodes are quite fun, as there is almost zero lag, and everyone has a chance. There is also a great player customization and a recent update that added 3 new super-cool helmets. It's glad to see this game still recieves attention from the developer, and has a great fan-base. There is always lots of people playing, its never hard to find a server.\nOverall, this game is great to play in short bursts with friends, or even many hours straight till your fingers fall off. This game is highly addicting, and at the price of only $5, it's definitely a wise decision to purchase this game. Many hours of fun awaits you.

reviewText: I wanted to write this review quickly before someone falls into the trap I did.  The reviews for this game suggest that it is some sort of amazing FPS experience.  It is not a complex experience.  A bunch of people spawn on a map, and you run around with a couple weapons trying to kill eachother.  Some people talk about how this is very much not like minecraft.  I'll agree that the goal is very different from minecraft.  The graphics (obviously) are similar.  The digging and placing blocks is very similar to minecraft, and is an annoying addition to this game.  I felt like half the time I was digging around trying to find the last player on infection mode, because they had dug into a strange place where nobody could find them.  Perhaps they placed some blocks to make it even harder to get at them.\n\nThis game doesn't do anything seriously wrong.  However, it also doesn't have the degree of depth that I was expecting after reading the reviews and looking at the steam store page.  I'm not recommending mostly because of how I feel I was tricked into believing it was something it isn't.

reviewText: So I log in and I'm greeted to a brilliant character customisation screen. I notice there are no unlockables, making everybody equal. I pimp out my character and enter the game. I look around and find a useful, and easy to read, help section telling me most of the mechanics of the game. I hop on an infection server and boy, it was a lot more than I expected. Brilliant mechanics such as devouring and tentacles so I can pull myself around and get the jump on my armed human enemies. Unfortunately they keep killing me, as there's only one of me. So what do I do? I dig under them with my secondary attack. I get one of them and soon I'm on them with my new team-mates devouring all in site. That was fun!". I then join a FFA server and have a great choice of weapons. From swords
recommended: to a shotgun which gives me camo. This game is not like any other
hoursPlayed: certainly not like Halo or Minecraft. The voxel-based system is purely to allow for easy mapmaking and movement; it works like a charm.\n\nTL;DR Brilliant game with great mechanics

reviewText:
OK, played some more after comments from dev.

The game reminds me of Cube 2 Sauerbraten (FPS + ability to co-op edit maps) but not as pretty and with slower pace. However it has vehicules, ability to destroy maps, and zombies for some modes.

The main differentiator is the Infestation mode where you turn into a zombie once dead. Zombies cannot pick-up guns but come with their own weapons (claws and tongue). Overall, this is a fun mode.

Main problem for me with the game is that the maps, while fun, are not well balanced. A lot of them are very open, which means that a sniper or someone flying high above with a vehicule can spam the map. You often see zombies coming from far away. There is an option to remove some weapon (e.g. sniper) so could potentially help, but it feels like a cheap trick.

The +
--- Co-op editing
--- Map variety - lots of them
--- Zombie are fun to play once you understand weapons/leveleving up mechanics

The -
--- Single player and co-op labels are misleading. The AI is too poor to really be single-player (zombie running toward you)
--- Most map design are not well balanced
--- Gameplay is straigt forward which is  a + but so simple it doesn't require much skills like quake/unreal for instance.

I'd rate it 4 out of 10. There are better arena FPS alternatives on PC.

reviewText: This game gets progressively boring after twenty minutes. Don't take this as harsh criticism, I'd still buy the game for the price they're asking for, but this game isn't meant for people to play for more than an hour at a time. This is one of those games where you can play for a bit before you burn out because this game burns out quickly unless you're with friends and even then, it can get tedious. It's a good game, but I can only say 7/10 because it's not really a game for time wasting, the genre makes it burn out quick, and the game tends to glitch out.

reviewText:
This game is a cheaply-built formula game, that takes the worst out of CoD, Halo, and Minecraft, and smashes it together into a library-ruining title called murder miners.

There are so many things wrong with this game, from the painfully small playerbase (Literally 2 servers normally), lack of guns, generic nature of the guns, and cheesy everything.

The textures are horrible, and look like they were taken from a minecraft photorealism 8x8 pack, and the models are worse than quake. The game's animations are absolutely attrocious, and have 2 or less keyframes at any given time. The game has no dedicated servers by the devs, and if they expected players to fill the gap, they were dead wrong.

Do not get this game, it is not worth it, and quite frankly, is overpriced at $2 USD.

Overwhelmingly Negative would not do this game justice. This is a scar in my account.

reviewText: heres the story.\ni was finally able to add some funds to my steam wallet and bought a couple of cs:go items, which left me with 2 bucks which i decided to spend on a cheap game in the under $5 category, i was surfing around the games when i finally saw muder miners. i clicked it to see the screenshots and the gameplay of the game and saw alot of good reviews so i decided to spend my money on this game, so i downloaded it opened it up and got to the screen where it let you customize your miner...and after that their wasnt much to do...their was only one server which i got bored of immediately all we did was shoot zombies for 27 minutes...i tried searching for ctf,infecting,mudermatch etc etc. but their was no servers, and thats sad because this game has alot of potential to be a great game..but until then theirs not much to do

reviewText:
I should've known better.
This game isn't bad, but it's EXTREMELY overhyped.
Think halo plus minecraft.
Now add tryhards.
Now add NO DEDICATED SERVERS.
Meaning only PLAYERS can host.
That ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• gets real ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ed up real fast, and the whole block mechanic sucks eggs.
There's no strategic implement in it, cos' last i checked, the only time it was ever used was to make a CTF map...
WITH ONE GOD DAMN LANE AND NOTHING ELSE.
LITERALLY A STRAIGHT LINE TO THE ENEMY BASE.
Play with your friends,
Not with complete strangers.

reviewText:
Okay I am getting rid of the old review, now I am starting to enjoy. So I see some rather good qualities on this game that are TOO OBSCURE to for Asia ( Clearly I know this area doesn't have any influence due to Xbox did not do well at all ) and Europe ( not sure how well halo did their ). I never played Halo at all, NEVER DUE TO! Where I live, no original xbox's sold well and Halo advertisements are not here...

So I had some hope with this game to be good, well I did not know what other fps design there is. There is the Halo.

Controls : It controls rather clunky due to lack of field of view, which cripples the game quite a bit depending what monitor you have, how far or how close you are. The control for me it is rather jagged due to short burts of energy and full runing. ._. Which makes it uncomfortable to control. Does not help with the annoying field of view.

Graphics: Barely passable, the game has a rather limited amount of blocks, and most of them use GREY, BLACK, and BROWN. Or essentially  Ugly pallete ". It doesn't improve with the graphical settings if curious. Looks the same and well field of view issues.

Level Editor: Clunky 100% It feels rather unfinished it does not help. There is no way in the game to make simple block and place. It makes it a chore to build and delete blocks due to this. I wished the game atleast has some tips on how to build a map like. Use " ALT ( or B if controller ) with a sniper riffle to build with and other tools.

Gameplay : Just Halo with some level design. Varies on gamemodes
date: the gamemode that actually is fanastic in this game is the zombie based ones. The DM maps are pure UNHOLY PAIN TO PLAY! While TDM is rather okay
recommended: okay is not decent. CTF I mean Kill the flag
hoursPlayed: Uhhh. I mean Murder the Flag
voteText: yes I appreciate the effort
helpfulPercent:
but no thanks.

What could improve the game? A freaking field of view slider. Dang it

reviewText:
Did you come for Halo-like gameplay?
Well, it shares a few features like shields and guns... but that's it...

Did you come for infection-type gameplay?
Well get ready to be dissapointed by tentacle-flinging zombies that go so fast that they can't be  avoided.

Did you come for building or minecraft-type gameplay?
The building controls with the miner gun or so confusing and bad, why not just give us a menu to where we can easily choose blocks to place down rather than some little gun that shoots blocks to break them, and makes choosing a block to place difficult?

Overall, the game isn't very fun. The zombies in infection and survival modes are so quick, the weapons are somewhat unbalanced, building is difficult and map-making is frustrating.

I'm confused on how this is a game too, there's nothing to unlock except 18 achievements, and there's a low amount of content unless you just want tons of maps and some character customization options.
